bug.short_desc: avoid nested scrollbars when expanding "Advanced" section when adding an attachment with long comment

long_desc.thetext:
Mylyn 3.7.0.I20111015-0643
Steps: 1. On the Task editor press the Attach... button 2. Navigate to the "Attachment Details" page 3. Enter at least 2 lines long comment 4. Expand the "Advanced" section => IS: a horizontal scroll bar shows up, the Comment field gets extremely long => SHOULD BE: none of the above, except for the "Advanced" section expanded

Agreed, the resizing behavior of the dialog should be improved. Implementation-wise the code should reuse the SectionComposite from the commons that has some support for handling scrollbars and resizing.

Suggested change looks good. Can you add your name to the copyright header and then drag and drop the commit to attach it to this bug so we can track the contribution? I'll then go ahead and apply the change. Thanks!

Created attachment 206094 The diff
(In reply to comment #3) > Can you add your name to the copyright header
Done in the latest patch set.
> and then drag and drop the commit to attach it to this bug
I wish I could. D'n'd did work but the commit content wasn't mine. It looked like a different commit, and it wasn't the previous one, go figure! So, I'm attaching a manually created diff. I hope it's ok.

Thanks! I have applied the patch to master.
(In reply to comment #4) ... > > and then drag and drop the commit to attach it to this bug > > I wish I could. D'n'd did work but the commit content wasn't mine. It looked > like a different commit, and it wasn't the previous one, go figure!
Benjamin, do you have any thoughts why this produced an unexpected result?
No idea. Tomasz, would be awesome if you can open a bug at EGit (and cc me) for that and tell me what HEAD~1 in your case was (I assume you were one commit away from origin/master with your HEAD).

(In reply to comment #7) > Tomasz, would be awesome if you can open a bug at EGit (and cc me)
Sure, it's bug 362338.
